info.description: Notifiarr Client monitors local services and sends notifications.
info.title: Notifiarr Client API Documentation

get.description: Returns information about the client's configuration. This endpoint returns all the instance IDs (and instance names if present). Use the returned instance IDs with endpoints that accept an instance ID.

post.description: Adds a new Album to Lidarr.

get.description: Fetches an Artist from Lidarr.
Checks if an album already exists in Lidarr.
Returns the search status of an album ID.
Returns all Custom Formats Data from Lidarr.

post.description: Creates a new Custom Format in Lidarr.

delete.description: Delete all Custom Formats from Lidarr.

put.description: Updates a Custom Format in Lidarr.

delete.description: Delete a Custom Format from Lidarr.

get.description: Fetches an Album from Lidarr.
Fetches all Metadata Profiles from Lidarr.
Returns Lidarr track naming conventions.

put.description: Updates the Lidarr track naming conventions.
Updates a Notification in Lidarr.

post.description: Creates a new Lidarr Notification.

get.description: Returns Lidarr Notifications with a name that matches 'notifiar'.
Fetches all Quality Definitions from Lidarr.
Fetches all Quality Profiles Data from Lidarr.

post.description: Creates a new Lidarr Quality Profile.

put.description: Updates a Lidarr Quality Profile.

get.description: Fetches all Quality Profiles from Lidarr.

put.description: Updates all Quality Definitions in Lidarr.

delete.description: Delete items from the activity queue.

parameters.description: tell download client to change categories?
parameters.name: changeCategory

get.description: Returns all Lidarr Root Folders paths and free space.
Searches all Album Titles for the search term provided.
Returns all Lidarr Tags.

put.description: Creates a new tag with the provided label.
Updates the label for a an existing tag.
Updates an Album in Lidarr.
Updates an Artist in Lidarr.

get.description: Returns true or false for each configured starr instance. True is up, false is down.

Returns true or false for every instance for starr app requested. True is up, false is down.
Multiple apps may be provided by separating them with a comma. ie /api/ping/radarr,sonarr
get.summary: Ping all instances for 1 or more starr apps.

get.description: Returns true or false for 1 requested instance. True is up, false is down.

post.description:
Accepts a Plex webhook; when conditions are satisfied sends a notification to the website,
and may include snapshot data and/or fetched session data. Does not require X-API-Key header.

parameters.description: Plex Token or Client API Key
parameters.name: token

get.description: Returns the Plex Library Directory.
Empties the Plex library trash for the provided library key. Get the library key from the Directory.
Kills a Plex session by ID and sends a message to the user.

parameters.description: Reason the session is being terminated. Sent to the user.
parameters.name: reason

get.description: Marks a movie or show or audio track as watched.
get.summary: Mark a Plex item as watched.

get.description: Returns Plex sessions directly from Plex.

get.description: Unmonnitors and returns a Sonarr Series Episode.

post.description: Returns custom format and related data for multiple Lidarr instances at once. May be slow.
post.summary: Retrieve custom format data from multiple Lidarr instances.

400.description: bad input payload or missing app

post.description: Returns custom format and related data for multiple Radarr instances at once. May be slow.
post.summary: Retrieve custom format data from multiple Radarr instances.

400.description: bad input payload or missing app

post.description: Returns custom format and related data for multiple Sonarr instances at once. May be slow.
post.summary: Retrieve custom format data from multiple Sonarr instances.

400.description: bad input payload or missing app

get.description: Start backup file check on all applications of a specific type.
Sync custom profiles and formats to Radarr.

parameters.description: Triggers sync on this instance if provided, otherwise all instances
parameters.name: instance

get.description:
Toggle client error log sharing.
This allows enabling and disabling of client error logs being shared with the website.

parameters.description: Enable or disable client error log sharing.
parameters.name: enabled

get.description: Execute a pre-programmed command.

parameters.description: Unique hash for command being executed
parameters.name: hash

post.description: Execute a pre-programmed command with arguments.

parameters.description: Unique hash for command being executed
parameters.name: hash

parameters.description: provide args as multiple 'args' parameters in POST body
parameters.name: args

get.description: Start corruption check on all application backups of a specific type.
Trigger a custom website timer. This sends a GET request to trigger an action on the website.

parameters.description: ID of the custom website timer to trigger
parameters.name: idx

get.description: Collects dashboard data and sends a notification.
Empties one or more Plex library trash cans.

parameters.description: List of library keys, comma separated.
parameters.name: libraryKeys

get.description: Trigger a pre-programmed endpoint URL passthrough request.

parameters.description: Name or URL of endpoint being triggered
parameters.name: name

get.description: Send Radarr Library Collection Gaps notification.
Sends Radarr and Sonarr Libraries for MDBList Syncing.
Write log entry, and send GUI notification if client has GUI enabled (mac/windows only).
Reconfigures actions based on website settings.
Reload this application's configuration immediately. Reload shuts down everything re-reads the config file and starts back up.
Sync custom profiles and formats to Sonarr.

parameters.description: Triggers sync on this instance if provided, otherwise all instances
parameters.name: instance

get.description: Reschedule all service checks to run immediately.
Collect Plex sessions and send a notifciation.
Collects system snapshot data and sends a notification.
Sends cached stuck items notification.
Uploads a log file to Notifiarr.com.

parameters.description: File to upload. Must be one of app, http, debug
parameters.name: file

get.description: Returns a list of triggers and website timers with their intervals, if configured.

200.description: lists of triggers and website timers

get.description: Returns information about the client's configuration, and polls multiple applications for up-status and version.

Returns information about the client's configuration, and polls 1 application instance for up-status and version.
Plex and Tautulli only support app instance 1.

message.description: This message contains the request-specific response payload.

status.description: The status always matches the HTTP response.

errors.description: Errors returned from the delete queries.

found.description: How many items are found and attempted to be deleted.

files.description: Number of files on disk for this book.

appsStatus.description: AppsStatus is only returned on the version endpoint.

commands.description: Commands is the list of available commands.

endpoints.description: Endpoints is the list of available endpoint url passthrough configs.

hostError.description: HostError has data if hostinfo has an error.

name.description: Instance name as configured in the client.

listen.description: Listen is the IP and port the client has configured.

up.description: Up is true if the instance is reachable.
Up is true if the instance is reachable.

clientinfo.PlexInfo.description: Contains some very basic Plex data, including the name and version.

up.description: Up is true if the instance is reachable.
Up is true if the instance is reachable.
Up is true if the instance is reachable.
Up is true if the instance is reachable.
Up is true if the instance is reachable.

args.description: Args and ArgValues are not config items. They are calculated on startup.

atTimes.description:
AtTimes is a list of 'hours, minutes, seconds' to schedule for Daily/Weekly/Monthly frequencies.
Also used in Minutely and Hourly schedules, a bit awkwardly.

daysOfMonth.description: DaysOfMonth is a list of days to schedule. 1 to 31 or -31 to -1 to count backward.

daysOfWeek.description: DaysOfWeek is a list of days to schedule. 0-6. 0 = Sunday.

frequency.description: Frequency to configure the job. Pass 0 disable the cron.

interval.description: Interval for Daily, Weekly and Monthly Frequencies. 1 = every day/week/month, 2 = every other, and so on.

kernelArch.description: native cpu architecture queried at runtime, as returned by `uname -m` or empty string in case of error

kernelVersion.description: version of the OS kernel (if available)

reqID.description: not from Plex, but added by Notifiarr.

trashSize.description: added later, not part of payload.

stateTime.description: this is not a plex item. We calculate this.

message.description: this is a weird place for a message

addOptions.description: only available upon adding a movie.

atTimes.description:
AtTimes is a list of 'hours, minutes, seconds' to schedule for Daily/Weekly/Monthly frequencies.
Also used in Minutely and Hourly schedules, a bit awkwardly.

daysOfMonth.description: DaysOfMonth is a list of days to schedule. 1 to 31 or -31 to -1 to count backward.

daysOfWeek.description: DaysOfWeek is a list of days to schedule. 0-6. 0 = Sunday.

frequency.description: Frequency to configure the job. Pass 0 disable the cron.

interval.description: Interval for Daily, Weekly and Monthly Frequencies. 1 = every day/week/month, 2 = every other, and so on.

metadata.description: arbitrary info about the service or result.

output.description: metadata message must never be nil.

since.description: how long it has been in this state, rounded to Microseconds

time.description: when it was checked, rounded to Microseconds

addOptions.description: to be used only on POST, not for PUT

monitor.description: Valid values for Monitor are: all, future, missing, existing, firstSeason, latestSeason, and none.

revision.description: Not sure which app had this....

apiPath.description: The client API path to trigger this custom timer.

id.description: Use this ID to trigger this timer with the trigger/custom endpoint.

timers.description: Timers provided by the website to offload scheduling.

triggers.description: Triggers and actions internal to the client.
